q: "We should hit Khurmal during the speech, given that Colin Powell will talk about it." Khurmal is the name of a village near the site. In his U.N. presentation, Colin Powell described it as Terrorist Poison and Explosive Factory, Khurmal. Rumsfeld said Khurmal was operated by Ansar al-Islam, a Sunni militant group with ties to Abu Musab al-Zarqawi , a Jordanian extremist with ties to the al-Qaida terrorist network. The saga of the "American Idol" phenomenon, from its origins in the 2001 hit British series "Pop Idol" right up to Simon Cowell 's departure, is the focus of Richard Rushfield's breezy, gossipy American Idol: The Untold Story. Currently an entertainment columnist for the website the Daily Beast and a Vanity Fair contributing editor, Simon Cowell Rushfield blogged about "American Idol" for three years for the Los Angeles Times and clearly knows his subject well.

a management restructure involving long-time chief executive Eric Schmidt becoming executive chairman. Eric Schmidt , who has led Google since 2001, will take on the new role on April 4, working mostly on external operations, including deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership .
